hook.text: Bangladesh may lose 17% of its land to rising seas. Where do 20 million displaced people go?

buildup.text: Climate change creates migrants. Floods, droughts, and extreme heat make regions unlivable, pushing people out.

discovery.text: The World Bank estimates 216 million climate migrants by 2050. That dwarfs every current refugee crisis.

twist.text: International law doesn't recognize 'climate refugees.' They have no legal right to asylum under current rules.

climax.text: Climate migration will reshape politics in receiving countries. Anti-immigrant backlash is already growing.

punchline.text: Climate forces people to move. Politics decides who gets in.

quiz.question: How many climate migrants does the World Bank estimate by 2050?
